data.title: Blue J (Youth) Requirements
data.text:
UPDATE – We have reached the max number of spots for 2024 Summer Blue J program and are no longer accepting new applications at this time. We will start accepting new application for 2025 Summer Blue J program on March 1, 2025. Application received prior to this date will not be accepted and we will be filling spots on a first come, first serve basis.

All Blue J’s must be 16 by June 1st in order to volunteer for the summer. There are no exceptions to this age limit.

Summer is approaching fast and I am so glad that you are considering volunteering at the Methodist Hospitals. Our new summer student volunteer program will start on June 10, 2024 and end on August 2, 2024 and consist of a rotation in different roles in our hospital.

Please note some important information you need to know –

Orientation dates will be held in May 2024. You must attend orientation prior to volunteering. These will be the only dates offered for Blue J’s, so please select one that suits your schedule. Due to limited space, we ask that parents not attend.

Please bring all of these items with you to orientation –

Signed contract agreeing to work a minimum of 32-hours from June 10, 2024 to August 2, 2024

Application must be filled out (online link)

Completed Background check 5-30

Immunization records with proof of two MMR vaccinations, Varicella verification and Tdap vaccinations

Two reference letters from non-related adults who know your character

Parental TB_Consent form for testing

$12 for membership dues and Polo shirt, additional shirts are $10 each

Orientation days, times and location will be sent to you after you have completed the application using the link above.

We will provide TB testing to you free of charge and you may take care of this at your earliest convenience AFTER orientation. The process for testing is listed below –

Contact Employee Health to set up an appointment and bring a printed copy of your immunization records, and the parental consent must be signed by a parent or guardian if you are under 18. You will fill out your information card at this time.

A nurse will administer the TB injection if you do not have documentation of any previous TB skin testing done within the last 3 months.

You must return two days later to have the test cleared or have to repeat the test. Employee Health will let Volunteer Services know you are cleared to begin.

Employee Health is located in the Plaza Building on 4499 Medical Drive, Suite 102. Their phone number is 210-575-9717 if you have any questions. Their hours are Monday through Friday, from 7am to 3:30pm.

We will be passing out a scheduling questionnaire at orientation please have an idea of days that you are available. Standard shifts are 8:30am-12:30pm and 12:30pm-4:30pm, Monday through Friday only. No weekends are available. You may also work all day if you choose. Please pick two shifts that work for you for now and we can add more as soon as we know how many volunteers are joining us.

Our new summer student volunteer program is available at Methodist Hospital but we also have our standard summer program available at Methodist Hospital | Specialty and Transplant, Methodist Hospital | Texsan and Methodist Hospital | Metropolitan. Junior volunteers are not allowed to work in the Children’s Hospital and I apologize for that. FYI – we always seem to lack junior volunteers Mondays and Fridays, so if you would like to pick those days, that is great! We limited spots available for our new summer student program at Methodist Hospital so if we fill up, we may ask you to volunteer at another of our facilities above if your days are not flexible. Please know we will work with you as best as we can. Summer usually brings us about 100 extra volunteers so we have to have a balanced schedule.

If you have any questions, please email me at Frances.Gutierrez@MHSHealth.com. If signed up but you will not be able to volunteer this summer, please email me as soon as possible. I have quite a waiting list!

Thank you for your interest in the Methodist Hospital new summer student volunteer program. I hope that you will have a productive and exciting experience while you are here!

Sincerely,

Frances Gutierrez

Director Volunteer Services
